page.title: 03 POST OFFICE
page.content: The Post Office is run by Mrs Hall who has worked there for 3 years. Her family have run it since 1937/8. It opens every day from 9am-5/30pm except Thursday when it closes at 12 noon and Saturday at l2.30pm. Mondays and Thursday mornings are the busiest times when people come for their pensions. On an average Monday there are 30-40 customers. People use the Post Office for buying stamps and posting letters. It has 2 collections a day. It is also used for paying bills and TV licences and for collecting pensions and family allowances. Mrs Hall balances the books every Friday and sends the returns off to Worcester. There is a public telephone box outside the Post Office.
